text: Brett Clark Connon (born 29 August 1996) is a rugby union player for Newcastle Falcons in Premiership Rugby. His primary position is fly-half; he has also featured at fullback. Born in Carlisle, England, he qualifies for through his father and has represented Ireland under 20s. ==Career== Connon started playing rugby around 6 years old for his local club Carlisle and also played for his school Austin Friars. He joined Newcastle Falcons academy at 15 and was identified by the IRFU's exiles programme and played for Ireland's under 18 team. He made his debut for Newcastle's first team on 14 October 2016 against the Ospreys in a European Rugby Challenge Cup match. On 10 March 2019, with the final kick of the match, Connon scored the winning penalty for Newcastle against Wasps. ==References== Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Newcastle Falcons rugby players Category:Rugby union fly- halves
title: Brett Connon
